longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for the period of intended stay. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of emergency or temporary passports.

Visa required, except for Holders of a valid "C" visa issued
by the United Kingdom (SEE NOTE 44436) (SEE NOTE 56994) to
nationals of Qatar, if they have first entered the United
Kingdom, for a max. stay of 90 days, or until the end of the
period of stay granted in the United Kingdom, whichever is
shorter. 
    NOTE 44436: For those arriving in the United Kingdom (UK),
   including  
    NOTE 56994: Not applicable to "C" visas issued for the
   purpose of transit, marriage or to enter into a civil
   partnership.
Visa required, except for Nationals of Qatar if they have
first entered the United Kingdom with a printed Electronic
Visa Waiver (EVW) Document issued by the United Kingdom, for a
max. stay of 90 days, or until the end of the period of stay
granted in the United Kingdom, whichever is shorter. 
Minors:
- Children up to/incl.16 years of age
  
- A separate visa is required for children up to/incl. 16
  years of age if  
- Visas issued to minors (persons under 18 years of age), with
  a date of issue after 12 October 2014,
   
Additional Information:
- Visitors holding passports containing a British inadmissible
  stamp could be refused entry.
- Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds to
  cover their stay. 
Warning:
- Entry stamps issued by the UK to nationals of Qatar having
  entered the UK with an Electronic Visa Waiver (EVW) Document
  are considered as sufficient for the purposes of entry into
  Ireland (Rep.). However, it is recommended to also hold a
  printed copy of the EVW at an Irish port of entry. 
- Visitors not holding return/onward tickets could be refused
  entry. 



 Ireland (Rep
